column4: Ubuntu 8.10 - Lost wired networking and keyboard on 2 laptops after installing updates yesterday .. using live CD now and i was wondering how to start debugging the issue ? Obviously without keyboard running diagnostic terminal commands is impossible .. quite lost, TIA for all pointers.
not 100% sure, but i believe it were some pulseaudio related packages ..
Can you use the keyboard in recovery mode?
no doesn't work in recovery mode either
Are you chatting from the same computer?
yes, booted from live CD to get internet connection working
Can you boot the other laptop in recovery mode and try pressing "alt+sysrq+r" ?
will try and report back, give me a few minutes .. and thanks :)
okay, that worked, got keyboard in recovery mode thx
Try continuing booting and see if the keyboard and mouse continue to work in X
negative, laptop keyboard still not working in X, usb mouse does work though
Does alt+sysrq+r get the keyboard working again in X?
nope, and no network either, looks like i will need to go for a re-install ,
thanks for your help, got to get to work, bye
First try "sudo dpkg --configure -a" in case the upgrade didn't finish ( not likely on two machines but it can't hurt to try )
okay, i'll keep looking in the forums and on launchpad for related bugs etc... have a nice day and thx again
